title: Alexei Navalny - Wikipedia
snippet: Alexei Anatolyevich Navalny (Russian: Алексей Анатольевич Навальный, IPA: [ɐlʲɪkˈsʲej ɐnɐˈtolʲjɪvʲɪtɕ nɐˈvalʲnɨj]; 4 June 1976 – 16 February 2024) was a Russian opposition leader, anti-corruption activist and political prisoner.

title: Russia of the Future - Wikipedia
snippet: Russia of the Future (Russian: Россия Будущего, romanized: Rossiya Budushchego, IPA: [rɐˈsʲijə ˈbudʊɕːɪvə]), originally known as the People's Alliance (Народный Альянс, Narodnyy Al'yans) and formerly called the Progress Party (Партия Прогресса, ...

title: Aleksey Navalny | Facts, Biography, Poisoning, Death, & Imprisonment | Britannica
snippet: He remained in Moscow to practice law and to continue his studies, and in 2001 he earned an economics degree from the Financial University under the Government of the Russian Federation. In 2000, while he was still a student, Navalny joined Yabloko, a political party that promoted liberal democracy and a market economy.

title: Kremlin Foe Navalny Launches New Political Party
snippet: Russian opposition leader Aleksei Navalny has launched a new political party, though he missed its founding due to a jail sentence over nationwide protests he organized against President Vladimir Putin.

title: True Beliefs and Opportunism: Navalny’s Tangled Political Development - The Moscow Times
snippet: In 1999, Navalny made his first foray into formal politics, joining the center-left pro-European liberal party, Yabloko.
